ratings.comment: The lectures are amazing and clark is a really good speaker. The exams are a little bit too much on details, but having the lecture notes make everything easier. Just go to class, review the lecture note and enjoy national park!
Prof Johnson was an incredibly engaging lecturer. The class wasn't too hard, but you've gotta but in a few nights of studying before each midterm if you wanna pass.
Liked his lectures but felt the tests were created in a way that made it hard to study at times, since it wasn't always easy to know what would be on the exams.

Great lectures, Luke Zoet gives about half of the lectures as well as a few other guest lecturers. Definitely not an easy A by any means but all 5 midterms, the only grades, are curved reasonably well. Pay attention in lecture and review a few nights before the test. Super interesting class for non-majors who love hiking!

Professor Johnson is great, all of the exam questions are chosen from a list of about 20 study questions he gives and answers and the end/beginning of lectures. He is very intelligent, and genuinely cares about his students.

This man is super passionate about volcanoes. Midterm is 40% of your grade, and final is 60% of your grade.. that's it. Show up to class, and look over your notes and you should be able to pass! (Also look at the old exams he puts online, as the old exam questions make up 50% of the exams)

He lets you make up questions at the end of lecture that will be on the tests so never skip lecture. For Geo 111 there are only 2 grades, a midterm and final, so don't blow them off or you won't pass. Tests are very detailed, so study the small stuff. Interesting material, lots of videos and lax class. Nice guy, very knowledgeable too.

The class was well organized and I learned a lot for a 1 credit class. If you want a decent grade, you have to go to class and study the lecture notes constantly. I used the ones he provided on Learn@UW since many answers were taken directly from there. This is not a fluff class by any means, but if you apply yourself and do the work you will do ok

Pretty interesting class and also pretty easy. He gives you many of the test questions during class which makes the tests pretty easy. Attendance is not mandatory but I would recommend going to get the test questions. Your whole grade is made up of two exams. Overall, great prof and class
He clearly is passionate about the material, and he is a pretty reasonable guy.

His lectures are great but for a 1-credit, non-geoscience major course, I thought the exam questions were too specific and it was hit or miss. I only took this course for gen eds so I didn't care too much about it to be honest. He is a very nice guy though, kept the material interesting, and he likes discussions in class.
Clark is low key hilarious. The tests are easy if you go to most lectures and do the practice tests.

This class is hard for a two credit class.  The lectures can get really dense and confusing for a beginner level science class.  There is not much talk about actual life in the universe (because there's none proven), but a lot about geologybiologyastronomy that would be helpful in finding it.  Tests are really hard and there's a final project.
Very tough class, I hope to get out with a C. I studied my butt off for this class and still struggled majorly
Clark is a good professor who does an excellent job of maintaining interest of the students. The class however is not particularly easy to get an A however.
probably the hardest 2 credit class you can take. avoid
His classes are interesting and make you feel comfortable. He talks mostly about the book and almost every single date that is or not important,which confuses me.
There's no textbook.  All of his slides and lecture notes are online, but you have to go to lecture because he randomly tells exam questions.  Overall pretty interesting.
He was a very interesting teacher and made lecture enjoyable! His enthusiasm shows through and makes you want to listen to him.

This class is really interesting!  Professor Johnson is a funny guy and definitely knows a lot about volcanoes.  Make sure to go to lecture and STUDY.  These tests are difficult for a one credit class, so don't blow this class off!

The class is interesting but probably should be worth more than 1 credit with the amount of studying that is required for the tests.  About half the class gets at least an AB, so overall its not that hard if you go to lecture and do the lecture readings.

Professor Johnson is a really nice guy, however it's a very difficult one credit course.  I attended most of the classes, however I have a lot of trouble with memorizing names and dates, which is what you have to do to receive good grades on the exams.  It is an extremely overwhelming amount of information to reiterate for a one credit class.
A ton of fun. Hilarious. You do have to put more time than necessary for a 1 credit class though. But he made the class too interesting to care.

Interesting and a nice guy, but the tests are difficult.  This class should be worth three credits for the amount of studying that is required. He expects you to know everything he says, and he does not provide helpful powerpoints. Interesting material, but hardest one credit class.

PROTIP: attend class. Everything you need to know is presented there, even specific questions on exams. Don't just rely on the online summaries and the past tests to prepare because both lack crucial info (he says this on the first day). Lots of memorization but mostly main concepts, not that hard. Easier if you've had geo, physics, chem classes.

He's an interesting teacher and the lectures are fun. However, his tests are extremely difficult. And that's all the class is based on. The midterm is 40%, and the final is 60%. He gives you exams from past years, and they help a bit but not enough to make this 1 credit class worth all the work that is needed to do well.
hardest 1 credit course you'll ever take in your life! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Class taught with two other professors, Eric Roden and Eric Wilcots. This was the first time the class was offered so it was a little unorganized lectures. But he made the subject of astrobiology very interesting.

The class was taught by three professors.  Of them all, Prof. Johnson was the easiest to understand, and he wrote fair questions for his portion of the exams.  The main points he wants you to get out of lecture come directly from his slides.  He made the class interesting, and he was very easy to follow along.
A heartless, spiteful, callous, and cruel man. I heard that he's responsible for de-planetizing Pluto, and that he did it because it was his ex-wife's favorite planet.
ridiculous. had to put in more effort for this class than my 4 credit courses... to get a C.

Like everyone else says, don't take this class expecting a typical easy 1 credit class.  I guess this exemplifies why Madison is the Harvard of the Midwest, but that doesn't mean the class doesn't suck.

so much memorization. If you attend lecture he gives you exam questions (which I attended all); however, the exam still had an impossibly large amount of memorizing. Lake Nyos was the carbon dioxide explosion one. thats what i know
All this memorization for 1 credit?  Really?

This class isn't hard. If you show up, he gives you like half of the questions on the midterm and final. He posts lectures online along with vid. clips. He is very nice and knows what he's talking about. Sometimes it's hard to follow because it's all completely new info, but definitely not a bad course for one credit.
Do NOT take this class.  This stupid class is taking up way too much of my time for ONLY  1 CREDIT!
So boring and pointless.
thought 1 credit class would be easy, hardest class im taking this semester (as a junior). pointless memorization, useless information. class is supposed to be a joke, definitely isnt.
Just awful for 1 credit.  Expected class to be easy and ended up being way too much memorization and in depth science.

Volcanoes is way more work than a one-credit class should be. You have to read the entire book, which is boring. Knowing all the volcanoes and everything that goes with is a pain in the butt; lots to study. Tests have mc, short answer and one essay. Clark sometimes shows clips of movies in class.

Clark taught this class with Brad Singer this semester. You can tell Clark is really into what he teaches. Slides are not that helpful or easy to understanding if you didn't go to lecture. If you want a good grade, you'll have to read the textbook a lot. Tests all MC. Discussion sections act as labs. Try to get Peter for your TA- he is amazing!

He is a good professor and very into his job - the class itself is hard tho - very specific questions and you have to memorize everything before the mid-terms.  final was not too bad tho.  Only take geo if you are actually interested or you'll die
Very good professor. He is enthusiastic and clear in explaining concepts. Definetly reccomend.
If you learn the termonolgy right away it's not too bad - it's hard to get an A but very easy to get a B...  read the book and memorize before the test.  The Dissc. are manditory

ok, at the start of class he says how u have to go to class, and read the book, this is kind of the case for the midterm.  The final was SO easy- it was just like last terms, and all the info u need is on the website, good class overall, got to watch interesting movies, GO VOLCANOES
Very good professor. Enthusiastic about what he teaches. Does a very good job using powerpoints and video clips to get the students to understand. Excellent class.
